fields.summary: Remove superfluous "=true" from some macro parameters
Ability to delete a revision of a page
Page Revision Security and Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1571].
  {panel}

Often I want to highlight a specific section of code within a {code} macro. But there is user specifyable coloring within {code}. Some brainstorming:

* Allow for {code:color=grey...} - This would turn off syntax highlighting.
* Within the macro allow for the use of {color} macro. 

Kinda klunky. Maybe this should not be added to {code}, but rather a sublcass of {code} or a new macro altogether so it could have clearer specification.

Does this make any sense?
fields.summary: Ability to highlight "changed" part of {code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1567].
  {panel}

We use conflucence for meeting notes, daily student assignement tasks lists, etc.

I end up copying a page text, to a new page, and saving it.

Other users were suggesting using the move feature, and then creating a new page with the same name.

It would be nice say, save this version of this page (add date to the page name), and lock the page. Basically, make a historic note of what the page said.

It might even be that these entries would be blogs, so that the blog features could be used.
fields.summary: save version of this page with date
Display last login time in UserBrowser
Better handling of java comments in code marco
Incorrect DataSource setup documentation (for tomcat at websphere & least)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1531].
  {panel}

During setup, on the "Setup Datasource Connection" page, the "DataSource Name" field should actually be called "DataSource JNDI Name".

a) because that is what it is
b) because some appservers (webfear, weblogic, etc) have a notion of a "datasource name" (its JMX name actually) which is usually different from its JNDI name.

(Also, a jndi name doesnt usually start with "jdbc/" )
fields.summary: JNDI Name field on "Setup Datasource Connection" page should be called "DataSource JNDI Name"
Permission to invite others into group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1503].
  {panel}

Several persons are working on the same side including me. 
In the daily diff report I only get the diff of the current version to current-1 version.
Changes between yesterday and current-1 version will not be reported in the daily diff-report.

Improvement: 
Option in daily Diff report with
- diff of current to current-1 version
- diff of current version to version yesterday, when daily report is generated (here i will get all changes on the side since me last diff report)

Regards 
Michael
fields.summary: Daily report should link to diffs for whole days changes, not just the last revision

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1475]. {panel} The templates need a way to specify the size of the editbox that's created. I wanted to create a page layour template for defining our plugin help pages, to sort-of specify what type of information is expected... but one section that's needed is the whole "description" of the plugin, which is at least a paragraph, and another needs to be a sentence or two for "each" settings. Working in the little boxes we're given now is so uncomfortable that noone will actually use them... And for our settings, it would be *awesome* to be able to specify, in the template, that a certain section should be repeated one or more times, so I could define something like:
Setting Name
Setting Description [Optionally, setting values:
  • value
  • value
  • value
]
And have the whole section, and internally, the 'value' section, repeated as often as necessary for any given plugin.
fields.summary: Template "space" is too small
Spam-protection
Display which user have read current page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1436].
  {panel}

We have a large amount of content that we would like to put into Confluence, but we are worried about the amount of space it will take and the additional size of the backups.

If we could store the files in a directory that:
a) Confluence can see locally (maybe within the confluence directories)
b) Can be accessed via a URL (maybe manual setup within Tomcat)

If the indexer could also look at these directories we can find these URLs easily.

If you could even index external sites that might be useful (although potentially time and space consuming).
fields.summary: Allow indexing of content outside of Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1422].
  {panel}

Currently there are only the following decorators available:

* Site Decorators
** Main
** Popup
** Printable
* Export Templates
** Space
** Page
* Content Templates
** Blog Post
** Listed Blog Post

It would be *really* useful if we could add to those lists, eg: a customA below printable and using a url like in the print button to change to it. At the moment 3 decorators for normal page displaying is too restrictive.
fields.summary: Custom / Additional Decorators
Separate the administrator priveleges from contact Administrator list
a true inheritance from templates
Hierarchical spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1406].
  {panel}

I'd like to tag page versions using a verbose tag, like tagging files in CVS.

The following operations should be possible:

1) Tag one page with a new tag -> marks the current revision with the tag
2) Move an existing tag to the latest version
3) Tag multiple pages with a tag, with the option to move existing tag

Then make it possible to export pages based on the tags on the page versions and some mechanism which would ease finding a set of document versions with a certain tag.
fields.summary: Page and space version tagging

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1383].
  {panel}

Add a drop-down (or radio?) list to the create-space screen:

Space Security:

* I will set my own custom permissions for this space
* Registered users may view this space
* Registered users may view and comment in this space
* Registered users may view, comment in and edit in this space
* Anyone may view this space
* Anyone may view and comment in this space
* Anyone may view, comment in and edit this space.
* Use same permissions as another space:

(1) would leave the default "only creator has perms"
(2-4) give permissions to "confluence-users"
(5-7) give permissions to "Anyone"

If last one is selected, activate a space drop-down.
fields.summary: Add permission schemes drop-down to "create space"
Use of Image Map

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1373].
{panel}
Original request:
{quote}We would like to have support for Hebrew (RTL language) both in search and editing within documents as well.
{quote}
This would include:
 * support for changing text direction in the editor
 * proper rendering of Right to Left (RTL) text on Confluence pages
 * support for text containing paragraphs or phrases with text in different directions (RTL and LTR)
 * indexing and searching support for RTL languages.

h3. Workaround

No known workaround for Confluence Cloud.
For Confluence Server, proceed to see the workaround stated in [CONFSERVER-1373|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1373].
fields.summary: Support RTL languages (e.g. Hebrew, Arabic, Persian) for editing and searching
Allow pages to be reordered prior to PDF export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1322].
  {panel}

It would be very useful if the Confluence Wiki markup supported HTML definition lists (i.e. the <dl>, <dt>, <dd> elements).  This is supported by other Wikis as for example JSPWiki, TikiWiki, and Meatball Wiki.

The proposed markup syntax would be:

;term one: definition of term one.
;term two:longer definition of
term two.

This would result in:

<dl>
 <dt>term one</dt>
 <dd>definition of term one.</dd>
 <dt>term two</dt>
 <dd>longer definition of
term two.</dd>
</dl>

An alternative syntax would be:

*;term:definition
fields.summary: Support for definition lists
Indexing to parse page content for links
Line numbering in code macro.
Text markup inside {code} should not be ignored.
Add ability to search historical pages and attachments
Automatic link creation using macros and keywords
Have separate prefs for enabling sending and receiving of trackbacks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1212].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 20 December 2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi Everyone,

Thanks for your continued feedback on this issue. 

As you can see, this issue was created quite some time ago, in fact a VERY long time ago on the scale of Web Browser development.

For a while now Chrome, Safari & Firefox have all had built in spellchecking, so as seen in the comments, this issue has become about providing support for Internet Explorer users.

For those that have been following the development of [Internet Explorer 10|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer_10], you'll know Microsoft has included spell checking as a feature in their recent Developer Previews. 

Once released, this will give Internet Explorer users native spell checking functionality, at which point there will no longer be any long term value in having this functionality in Confluence. As such, today we are closing this request. 

Regards,
John Masson
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}

A spell checker would be really nice.
fields.summary: Spell Checker
Warn when page is concurrently edited by multiple users
Provide for monospace text with formatting
Allow for bulk-type operations
Need a way to show all blogs posted by a user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1107].
  {panel}

creating FAQs via child pages is neat. (e.g.

http://activemq.codehaus.org/FAQ

however when looking at the pages in a space, it'd be nice to show the hierarchy, rather than just a flat list. Any way to enable this?

e.g.

http://docs.codehaus.org/pages/listpages.action?key=ACTIVEMQ

there's no easy way to see the pages included inside of the FAQ page etc.

I'd like it to be more visually obvious of how to add to FAQ entries. (Maybe its just my pilot error?). Though I think TimTam shows this anyways - so whenever TimTam works on OS X I might have a workaroudn

e.g. when I've 100 FAQ entries in different categories, I'd like to be able to see this visually in the page list view
fields.summary: show space/page hierarchies in the page view?
Export PDF to span multiple spaces
Nested Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1093].
  {panel}

Currently the list of supported Syntax Highlightings in the \{code} macro are limited, and will require to be altered as the support languages develop (eg: to include Generics in Java 1.5).

It is suggested that the highlighting rules, regular expressions and word lists be made dynamic - pulling from configuration files (xml prefered). This way languages can be added and altered by end users and atlassian alike. Programs like Edit Plus / TextPad already do this, in their own way - and import / conversion routines would be nice too (saves redefinition).

Finally, at the last phase Armond suggests to open the interface to the users either to directly define their syntax highlighting format via web UI or to import from the already existed ones!

[Issue Creation recommended by Armond Avanes in related issue CONF-893]
fields.summary: User Defined Syntax Highlighting
Support for translated page managment
HTML import into Confluence
Bulk space permissions editing for global administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1029].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have a feature in the administration section that could close the site for all non administrative users. Users without administrator access would only receive a page that said:
--------

                        SITE IS DOWN


       <Reason text configurable in the admin section.>


--------

This would allow administrators to close the site before doing backups(exports) prior to upgrading the application, minimizing the chance for users to modify anything between a backup and an upgrade/restore.
fields.summary: Site is down for maintenance page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1009].
  {panel}

I would like to able to gather the following information for tracking purposes:

- total number of users logged in
- total pages changed in the last 5 minutes, 2 hours, 4 hours, days
- durration of visit (if possible)
- size of spaces (in terms of # pages, bytes size, attachment size)
- page hits (with the ability to ignore search engines)

This is only a small list as I'm sure there are many more metrics that could be gathered.
fields.summary: JMX Interface for site statistics
Virtual-Hosting
Access to source IP address of any anonymous changes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-996].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of January 8, 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Thank you to everyone for your suggestions and feedback on this issue. Based on customer conversations and comments on this ticket, the most prevalent need in this area is the to manually remove specific versions of a page for the purposes of removing confidential information (e.g. passwords). Therefore, in the next version (Confluence 5.0) we plan to provide the ability for space administrators to manually remove specific versions of a page. We will mark this feature as closed once we ship 5.0.

There have been a number of comments requesting additional functionality beyond this for the purposes of minimizing database storage requirements or for adhering to content retention requirements. We have opened another JIRA issue for this use case which can be found at CONF-27701.

Thanks again for your comments and contributions.
{panel}

There are several reasons why it would be useful to be able to remove historical versions of selected pages:

- to remove confidential information which was accidentally added while editing the page
- to reduce the database usage of Confluence, particularly on frequently- or automatically-updated pages
- to comply with legislative document destruction requirements (e.g. delete content older than some years).

Practically speaking, this might be implemented in a number of different ways:

- ability to remove old versions of pages older than specific date (e.g. get rid of anything older than 6 months)
- ability to limit the number of old versions kept (e.g. limit to 5 previous versions)
- ability to remove specific old versions from one or more pages.

These tasks could be done manually via space admin, triggered by an automatic housekeeping task, or done manually for specific pages.
fields.summary: Allow removal of page version history for Space Administrators
Include attachment action in previous revision log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-990].
  {panel}

At the moment files are attached on a page by page basis. It would be better if there was also a place to put space specific and global files. 

For example: We have images which are used iconically all over the place in a space, and some which are used over the whole confluence site. For now we have to store the icons separately and link out to them explicitly. It would be nicer to store them in a global / space repository where they can be references something like this:

!image.gif! - image on this page
!anotherPage|image.gif! - image on anotherPage in this space
!SPACE:anotherPage|image.gif! - image on anotherPage in the space SPACE
!|image.gif! - image in the space repository for this space
!SPACE:|image.gif! - image in the space repository for the space SPACE
!$GLOBAL$|image.gif! - image in the global repository

The same could be done for all files (swf's, exe's, zip's etc). We would need some way of linking directly to a file and not just a link to the anchor of file listings. See issue CONF-989
fields.summary: File Repository

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-984].
  {panel}

At the moment I can create pages with names like "To be continued..." or "Stars - Little Galaxy Burps", however I cant create a page titled "Help! I'm a fish!" due to restricted characters in Page Title.

I understand that some extended characters (^, !, | etc) are used for other purposes but I can see there being two ways out of this:

1. Escaping - "Help\! I\'m a fish\!"
2. Implementation of Alternative Titles, so I could set the page title to "aquamarine.fish.helpme" and the alternative title set to something else. You would continue to link to "aquamarine.fish.helpme" but on the page itself (in the breadcrumb trail, in the page display, in the hierarchical view, in the children list etc) it would show the alternative title. [aquamarine.fish.helpme] would show "Help! I'm a fish!" as the link, perhaps this could be an option which could be configured in the administration area ... "Use displayed title where entered?" or something like that.

I think there is an issue around for #2. This could be entirely optional (it would default to showing the page title as the alternative / display title) and the page title could continue to be used with the current characters allowed. This would also make it compatable with previous system data. The tables could be extended to fit on upgrade.

The related issue is CONF-885

Note - this may be a duplicate, but I searched around and couldnt find any issues ... Maybe Im looking in the wrong place.
fields.summary: Extended Characters to be allowed in Page Title
Make {jiraissues} macro's output column sortable
Profile Templating
Better error-handling for RSS macro if it finds HTML page
Ability to edit default space homepage title and content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-762].
  {panel}

Documentation standard in our department is Docbook, and we have set up build-processes for our documentation already.  Thus it would be _very_ handy to export Docbook files directly from Confluence.
---
*Atlassian Update: November 10, 2011* 

Hi All,
Thanks for your patience on this issue. After some thought we have come to the conclusion that this is not something we would consider to be core and strategic to Confluence. This is a feature request which we are open to partners and plugin developers tackling as we don't have any intention on doing this.

One of our partners, [k15t|http://k15t.com] have just released their [Scroll Wiki DocBook Exporter|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/725767] for Confluence which satisfies this issue.

Cheers,
Sherif Mansour
Product Manager
fields.summary: Docbook Export
Extra PDF generation footer options
Let users request group membership
Option to approve new users
Enable comments inside pages, not just at the end of a page
Ability to sort lists of pages by update time, creator, etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-208].
  {panel}

We would like to have :

* Reusable sub page components (portlets) some provided by atlassian, some written by us ( We can't wait for you to do all the work , and neither can you :-)

* All portlets should be user editable - made of html + velocity a la roller

* Flexible Interactive Page Layout - Similar to the JIRA dashboard
some pre defined e.g Dashboard, Wiki, Space Home,...

* Customisable Navigation - Both meta data driven , and static using a hand written nav portlet

* Multiple built-in sub-page(portlet) types ( RSS Agg, Calendar , Free Form ) ( as mentioned above they should still be user editable, and be htnl+velocity based )

Attached is a mockup of the portlet based dashboard .

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of June 27, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Thank you all for your suggestions and feedback on this. We agree, it would be helpful to be able to tailor navigation to your needs with flexible and easy to use modules/portlets.

This is something we would like to implement but don't have any plans for at the moment. We will update this issue as we make further progress on it.

Warm regards,
 Elaine Hankins
 Sr. Product Manager, Confluence Cloud
{panel}
fields.summary: Customisable dashboard with portlets

fields.description:
h2. Environment Details

This bug occurs only on the following environment configuration:

* Windows machine
* IntelliJ Idea Ultimate Edition 2016.3
* JDK 1.6 and JDK 1.7

h2. HTR
# Install Clover plugin to IntelliJ
# Run tests with using JDK 1.7 or JDK 1.6

h2. Expected result

Tests are run, sources are instrumented and coverage is gathered properly.

h2. Actual result

NullPointerException is thrown from compiler process:

{noformat}
Information:java: java.lang.NullPointerException
Information:java: 	at com.atlassian.clover.idea.build.jps.CloverJavaSourceTransformer.transform(CloverJavaSourceTransformer.java:90)
Information:java: 	at org.jetbrains.jps.javac.TransformableJavaFileObject.getCharContent(TransformableJavaFileObject.java:51)
Information:java: 	at com.sun.tools.javac.main.JavaCompiler.readSource(JavaCompiler.java:483)
Information:java: 	at com.sun.tools.javac.main.JavaCompiler.parse(JavaCompiler.java:550)
Information:java: 	at com.sun.tools.javac.main.JavaCompiler.parseFiles(JavaCompiler.java:804)
Information:java: 	at com.sun.tools.javac.main.JavaCompiler.compile(JavaCompiler.java:727)
Information:java: 	at com.sun.tools.javac.main.Main.compile(Main.java:353)
Information:java: 	at com.sun.tools.javac.api.JavacTaskImpl.call(JavacTaskImpl.java:113)
Information:java: 	at org.jetbrains.jps.javac.JavacMain.compile(JavacMain.java:180)
Information:java: 	at org.jetbrains.jps.javac.ExternalJavacProcess.compile(ExternalJavacProcess.java:189)
Information:java: 	at org.jetbrains.jps.javac.ExternalJavacProcess.access$400(ExternalJavacProcess.java:48)
Information:java: 	at org.jetbrains.jps.javac.ExternalJavacProcess$CompilationRequestsHandler$1.run(ExternalJavacProcess.java:254)
Information:java: 	at org.jetbrains.jps.service.impl.SharedThreadPoolImpl$1.run(SharedThreadPoolImpl.java:44)
Information:java: 	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:439)
Information:java: 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
Information:java: 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
Information:java: 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
Information:java: 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
Information:java: 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}

h2. Workarounds

This bug seems to be related only with the specific environment configuration specified in the first point. The easiest workaround is  to use newer JDK version.
fields.summary: NPE during test execution on IntelliJ 2016.3 Windows and java version below 1.8
Instrumentation error for generic array constructor reference

fields.description:

fields.description:
See also --CLOV-1956--.

In case HUDSON_HOME contains space character, build with Hudson Clover Plugin fails because -lib is quoted twice. It happens in both cases:
 * when put in quotes is enabled

{code:java}
[workspace] $ ant clover.fullclean clean test.run -d -Dclover.skip.current=true -Dclover.optimization.enabled=false -lib '"/Users/mparfianowicz/.hudson 3.3.3/plugins/clover/WEB-INF/lib/clover-4.1.2.jar"' -listener com.atlassian.clover.ci.AntIntegrationListener '-Dclover.license.path="/Users/mparfianowicz/.hudson 3.3.3/jobs/abc/workspace/.clover/clover.license"' 
Apache Ant(TM) version 1.9.6 compiled on June 29 2015 
Trying the default build file: build.xml 
Buildfile: /Users/mparfianowicz/.hudson 3.3.3/jobs/abc/workspace/build.xml 
BUILD FAILED Class not found: com.atlassian.clover.ci.AntIntegrationListener 

{code}
 * when put in quotes is disabled

{code:java}
[workspace] $ ant clover.fullclean clean test.run -d -Dclover.skip.current=true -Dclover.optimization.enabled=false -lib '"/Users/mparfianowicz/.hudson 3.3.3/plugins/clover/WEB-INF/lib/clover-4.1.2.jar"' -listener com.atlassian.clover.ci.AntIntegrationListener "-Dclover.license.path=/Users/mparfianowicz/.hudson 3.3.3/jobs/abc/workspace/.clover/clover.license"
Apache Ant(TM) version 1.9.6 compiled on June 29 2015
Trying the default build file: build.xml
Buildfile: /Users/mparfianowicz/.hudson 3.3.3/jobs/abc/workspace/build.xml

BUILD FAILED
Class not found: com.atlassian.clover.ci.AntIntegrationListener

{code}
Note that '-lib ..clover.jar' is always put in double quotes by AntIntegrator.

Probable fix:
 * honour putValuesInQuotes property for -lib or
 * do not put in quotes at all
fields.summary: Hudson Clover Plugin fails to run if HUDSON_HOME contains space character

fields.description:
Test Clover against IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3 EAP (build 163.5219.11), released on Sep 28, 2016.

Problems found:

1) In IDEA 2016 the Preferences dialog (on OSX - IDEA -> Preferences, on Linux/Windows - File > Settings) does not show "Clover (project settings)", we see the "Clover (global settings)" only. 

Workaround: open on the 'Cloverage' view, click 'Filters' button. It opens the "Clover (project settings)" dialog with the 'Filters' tab preselected; it's possible to switch to other tabs as well.

(/) fixed

2) The "Clover (global settings)" is assigned to the "Other Settings" category. Consider moving it to the "Build, Execution, Deployment" (in this category is placed the IDEA's "Coverage" plugin).

(/) moved both "Clover (project settings)" and "Clover (global settings)"

3) Colour pickers have white checkboxes instead of showing the current colour:

 !idea16_white_checkboxes.png|thumbnail! 

(/) fixed and improved - replaced by JPanels:

 !colours_new.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3

fields.description:
*Problem*

Clover Maven Plugin replaces list of artifacts and artifacts dependencies by using an artifact with the "clover" classifier if any such exists. 

This is useful for "clover:instrument" goal and multi-module Maven builds, because this way instrumented module can use instrumented dependencies (instead of normal ones). 

However, a build can have an artifact being a '/target/classes' folder (for a current module compiled). Maven's artifact resolver resolves such directory to be an artifact with a "clover" classifier too. Example:

 !aspectproject-normal-jar.png|thumbnail! 

 !aspectproject-clover-jar.png|thumbnail! 

As Clover "sees" such artifact as resolved, it replaces it by the "clover" one, despite the fact that this is the same location. 

This is superfluous. 

In a normal build it works fine, but it fails when aspectj-maven-plugin is used together with clover-maven-plugin. See:
 * https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39984820
 * CLV-6357 ticket

*Possible fixes*
 * do not add "clover" classifier to artifacts in the same location
 * do not swizzle artifacts in clover:setup
 * do not swizzle artifacts if useCloverClassifier=false (extend usage of this property)

*Workaround*

Set cloveredArtifactExpiryInMillis=-1. This will trick Clover to see all 'clover' artifacts as outdated. Warning in logs is produced:

{quote}
[WARNING] Using [<artifact>], built on <date> even though a Clovered version exists but it's older (lastModified: <date> ) and could fail the build. Please consider running Clover again on that dependency's project.
{quote}

 * note that setting useCloverClassifier=false does not help (this is for output artifacts, not dependencies)
 * note that changing "clover:instrument" to "clover:setup" does not help
fields.summary: Clover Maven Plugin adds "clover" classifier for directory-based artifacts

fields.description:
When a method context filter is configured in IDEA (e.g. ".*toString.*"), a method is filtered-out in the source editor:

!method_context_filtered_in_source.png|thumbnail!

However, it is not being filtered out in the project tree in the Cloverage view - code metric shows "1" instead of "0" for this method:

!method_context_ignored_in_metrics.png|thumbnail!

Furthermore, when coverage data is being exported to the HTML report, even if the "use current filter settings" is enabled, it ignores the method context defined:

!method_context_ignored_in_html_export.png|thumbnail!

!method_context_not_filtered_in_html_source.png|thumbnail!

At the same time, when an HTML report is generated from Maven, for instance, it applies the filter mostly correctly (mostly because it filters-out the most from a class complexity, but it could show "0" for a method itself too):

!html_report_with_filter.png|thumbnail!

!html_report_without_filter.png|thumbnail!

!html_report_class_methods.png|thumbnail!

*Expected behaviour*

All methods excluded by the method context filter should affect code metrics.
fields.summary: Code metrics should take into account method context filter in IDEA

fields.description:
Changing {{Exclusion Annotation}} makes Annotations in Eclipse behave inconsistently and changes are not applied right away to current editor window. 

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Open Coverage Explorer window
# Change settings {{Exclusion Annotation}} settings
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Actual behavior

Annotation settings are not applied to any editor windows.

h2. Expected behavior

Annotations should be hidden or not according to selected preferences.

h3. Workaround

In order to get changes applied user needs to restart Eclipse. Sometimes it's not sufficient and it's still required change coverage highlighting settings back and forth to see Clover annotations. 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Exclusion Annotations setting works non-deterministic way in CEP plugin

fields.description:
*Current status*

Groovy 2.3 introduced traits - a code construct for composition of behaviours:
 * http://docs.groovy-lang.org/latest/html/documentation/core-traits.html

Currently Clover handles them like an interface - it records the class name in a database but it does not instrument the class, so it shows no code coverage in reports for them. 

Side note: Clover's reports by default do not show classes containing no executable code (empty classes, plain enums, interfaces with no default methods, traits) - you can show them by setting [showEmpty=true|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOVER/clover-report] parameter.

*Proposed improvement*

Instrument Groovy traits like normal classes or enums. 

Side note: Groovy 2.5 will probably not introduce interfaces with default methods (like in Java 8). 
 * http://docs.groovy-lang.org/next/html/documentation/#_interface

*Technical obstacles*

* method '$CLV_R$' is private but should be public in a trait
* method 'com_atlassian_clover.CoverageRecorder $CLV_R$()' must not be static; only fields may be static in a trait
* field '$CLV_R$' is not 'public static final' in a trait
fields.summary: Instrument Groovy traits and show code coverage for them

fields.summary: Could not find 'target/site/clover/clover.xml'.  Did you generate the XML report for Clover?

fields.description:
Ant prior to version 1.9.7 incorrectly handled arguments containing white space characters (they were being passed as separate arguments). For this reason, we put various paths (e.g. path to a license file) in double quotes. 

This has been fixed in Ant 1.9.7. However, as a consequence it does not strip double-quotes now, so paths are interpreted literally - with quotes.

We need a fix on Clover side, but at the same time to keep compatibility with older Ant versions. 

Consider adding proper flag for Clover-for-Ant tasks (e.g. "withQuotes=true").

See also:
 * BAM-10740
 * BAM-17201
fields.summary: Fix Ant 1.9.7 double quotes

fields.description:
*Problem*

I would like to configure {{targetPercentage}} to enforce a minimum percentage of coverage across a project and utilize {{historyDir}} and {{historyThreshold}} to ensure that the coverage does not drop.

The check[1] documentation says that these two configuration options are mutually exclusive.
{quote}
This will only be used if there is no targetPercentage parameter set.
{quote}

https://docs.atlassian.com/clover-maven-plugin/latest/check-mojo.html#historyDir

*Expected behaviour*

If both {{targetPercentage}} and {{historyThreshold}} are set, Clover should validate against these two values and fail a build in case at least one condition is not met.

*Workaround*

Run clover:check twice, for instance by using two profiles with different Clover settings:

{code:xml}
<profiles>
  <profile>
    <id>clover-target-percentage</id>
    <build>
      <plugins>
        <plugin>
          <groupId>com.atlassian.maven.plugins</groupId>
          <artifactId>clover-maven-plugin</artifactId>
          <configuration>
            <targetPercentage>80</targetPercentage>
          </configuration>
        </plugin>
      </plugins>
    </build>
  </profile>
  <profile>
    <id>clover-history-threshold</id>
           ...
          <historyThreshold>1</historyThreshold>
  </profile>
</profiles>
{code}


{noformat}
mvn clover:check -Pclover-target-percentage
mvn clover:check -Pclover-history-threshold
{noformat}
fields.summary: Support targetPercentage and history comparisons
